#include <stdio.h>

int main() {

    int n, m;
    if(scanf("%d %d", &n, &m) != 2) {
        // error handling, but probably not needed for this problem
    }

    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        char row[m+1];
        fgets(row, m+1, stdin);
        for(int j =0; j < m; j++) {
            if(row[j] == '.') {
                if( (i +j) & 1 ) {
                    row[j] = 'W';
                } else {
                    row[j] = 'B';
                }
            }
        }
        printf("%s\n", row);
    }

    return 0;

}
